title: Child rapist raked in £115,000 on benefits scam after claiming he needed wheelchair while jet-skiing and running - Mirror Online
text:

A child rapist who brought a judge to the verge of tears with his shocking crimes raked in more than £115,000 in a benefits scam. 
Michael Miszczak, 54, raped and beat two young girls during a campaign of “grotesque” abuse. 
Judge Denis Watson, QC, fought back tears as he described his sick crimes, which police said were among the most despicable they had ever seen. 
He was caged for 25 years earlier this week. 
Following his sentencing, the Liverpool Echo today reveals Miszczak was previously jailed over a benefits scam after falsely claiming he needed a wheelchair and constant care while jet-skiing and riding a camel. Read More ISIS threat to UK 'as great as IRA in the 1970s', says new terror law chief Judge Denis Watson QC fought back tears while describing Miszczak's sick crimes (Photo: Liverpool Echo) 
The pervert appeared on ITV’s Tonight With Trevor McDonald as part of a study into Britain’s “sicknote culture”. 
The ex-miner claimed a work accident left him incapacitated, but video footage revealed him jet skiing on holiday in Australia, camel riding and lifting a scaffolding rig into a van. 
Footage, taken from surveillance and home videos gathered by investigators, led to him being jailed for 12 months in September 2004. 
Miszczak was paid £250,000 compensation from the National Coal Board after a mining accident at Parkside colliery, near St Helens, in 1989. Read More Wife drove Mercedes-Benz convertible and splashed cash on jewellery and designer handbags while fraudulently claiming £110,000 in benefits 
He received £115,000 in benefits between August 1993 and October 2003, after claiming he was severely disabled and needed constant care to help with hygiene and a wheelchair. 
But investigators followed him after a tip-off and unearthed a damning collection of home movies, which revealed the extent of his lies. 
He admitted eight charges of false accounting and 11 of obtaining property by deception – repaying £115,411 to the state after selling his house. 
Earlier this month Miszczak was found guilty of 10 charges, including child rape, indecent assault and child cruelty, following a trial at Liverpool Crown Court. Like us on Facebook
